tags: this was an incoherent mess but im angry
summary: Please can someone explain this blind worship of drogo and his relationship with dany. It gets me so fucking angry because all I...
body: Please can someone explain this blind worship of drogo and his relationship with dany. It gets me so fucking angry because all I see is a rapist and basically a child with Stockholm syndrome. Everyone raves about how they are the true love story of GoT even HBO used them as a Valentine’s Day video (last year). It makes me so goddamn angry.

tags: i wanna see some cool shit with the ice dragon not gonna lie
summary: So I was thinking about how in the trailer it doesn't seem like Dany or the dragons are involved in the fight. There's fire in...
body:
So I was thinking about how in the trailer it doesn’t seem like Dany or the dragons are involved in the fight. There’s fire in the background sure but no signs of Dany on Drogon or even the Night King with a dragon. I mean it’s possible that those moments were being kept under wraps for the trailer so we’re even more excited when we see them the first time but… It just makes me wonder why we didn’t even get a glimpse.

It would be kind of crazy if something major happens and Dany abandons the fight. Or she does something that forces even her most loyal of subjects to abandon her cause but remain there to fight the night king

This is the end game, so much could happen now. It’s anyone’s game.

summary: Varys and Tyrion treating Daenerys as unreasonable, and maybe even potentially unstable, in their private conversations angers...
body:
Varys and Tyrion treating Daenerys as unreasonable, and maybe even potentially unstable, in their private conversations angers me beyond measure.

Having the nerve to act in such an entitled manner after she lost both her allies’ armies as an immediate result of their counsel; after she discovered Varys’ plan to have her assassinated, yet still had the temperance to calmly ask him to address any future concerns about her leadership to her, instead of going behind her back. This blatantly sexist attitude pretty much sums up the shit every female leader in history has had to put up with.

Any male figure in similar circumstances would have been furious and likely lashed out at his advisors, whether they were actually responsible (as was the case for Daenerys) or not. As to finding out a close advisor conspired against them in the past, and all but admits that he would do it again ‘for the good of the realm’? They would have his head before he was done speaking.

Daenerys manages to remain composed and do nothing of the sort, yet she’s still somehow viewed with patronising disapproval by her male allies, deemed ‘out of control’ for expressing rightful anger and taking things in her own hands instead of blindly following more of their, clearly ineffective (or should I say catastrophic?), advice.

This reminds me of just how fitting some of Missandei’s past words are where Daenerys’ leadership is concerned; the opinion she expresses when Dany asks for advice regarding the political situation in Meeren. ‘‘I can only tell you what I have seen, Your Grace. I have seen you listen to your counselors. I have seen you lean on their experience when your own was lacking and weigh the choices they put before you. And I have seen you ignore your counselors… because there was a better choice. One that only you could see.’’

The Lady of Thorns’- arguably one of the best players in the game- advice to her, encapsulates this very same message “He’s a clever man, your Hand. I’ve known a great many clever men. I’ve outlived them all. You know why? I ignored them. The lords of Westeros are sheep. Are you a sheep? No. You’re a dragon. Be a dragon.”

The myth of female hysteria is as old as time and it’s always utilised in order to doubt and dismiss a woman, ever present in fiction as much as life.

I’m truly hoping Season 8 does her character justice on that font, though the narrative doesn’t give me much reason to, unfortunately.
